page.title: 04Farming in Knockholt (2)
page.content: There are three farms with dairy units. Oveney Green Farm exports in-calf pure-bred Fresian heifers to the European market where there is a great demand. Store cattle are reared and fattened for markets in the South East. One farm has a flock of 400 mule crossbred sheep with about 9 rams, another flock are crossbred with Texal rams. There is a smallholding with pigs. Small numbers of sheep are kept in private paddocks and one family that breed pigs for their own use also keep chicken, ducks and turkeys and have a calf to fatten for meat, and goats for their own milk. There are two chicken farmers, one of whom delivers eggs locally. The Chevening Estate has a forestry unit, conifers, cherry, oak and beech are the main species planted. They also rear pheasants.
